result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Cole Larson

defendant.name: Larson, Lucas Cole
defendant.address: 655 South Main Street, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's office on behalf of Victim Witness. mw
Request for Victim to Appear by Zoom for the 11/3/22 INIT. Filed by ADA Becker 11:27 am. mw

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S. Ohmann & 134 Paulson Rd River Falls WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:59 PM Apprs: Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for S. Needham, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: B Harris, Defendant Lucas Cole Larson in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius appeared by video for Lucas Cole Larson for today only.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE confirms address on file. DE does not qualify for PD. Atty Firkus represents DE in another matter.  DE would like a different attorney.  DE given PFAC.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Bond argument.  Court orders bond and schedules next hearing. Speedy prelim demand.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
